review_blob: Clear Iris aroma, barnyard, nuts, jasmine, caramel, lemon, light grain notes with hay. Heavy oak on taste, vanilla, musty cellar, lemon, barnyard, quite earthy and complex. This will probably be amazing with age.
Bubblegum, lots of esters, cereal, acetaldehyde sweetness. taste of grain, bubblegum, and cooked vegetables. Super overcarbonated, gusher to begin with. Really bad.

Big aroma of cherry. Cherry juice, vanilla, oak, light almond, musty & earthy, a bit roquefort. Very cherry forward in taste, light acidity, lots of tannins, light oak with a noticeable cherry pit presence.
Apple skins, overripe mango, passionfruit, lemon and horse blanket. Taste a bit more sour then the normal quetsche, a bit more fruit presence and a bit more lemony. Solid and preferred.
beer_name: Oude Quetsche Tilquin  lAncienne avec Prunes de Namur

review_blob: Green apples, citron, oak, vanilla, very floral with a nice underlying lambic profile. Easy going and not too sour, quite mellow plum presence.

Aroma of cherry pits, light nail polish, wood and general red berries. Taste pretty intensely sour, acetic acid, green apple, cherries, raspberries, a bit nail polish. Would be great without the nail polish thing, a bit too acidic.
Aroma of smoke, licorice, wood, butterscotch, light diacetyl, caramel, bread, hazelnuts and ash. Great taste of banana bread, caramel, licorice with a smoky finish. This is a fantastic beer.

Big aroma of sweet milk chocolate, vanilla, caramel. Taste of dulce de leche, chocolate, espresso and caramel. Quite sweet and cloying. Great cocoa taste alike Prairies Bomb, and a clear caramel sweetness from Omnipollos stouts, a great showcase of both breweries big ability to make great stouts. Minus points is that it is slightly too acidic, which erupts towards the end and takes over.
beer_name: Omnipollo / Prairie Omniprairie aka Abundantia Milk Choc. Caramel Stout

review_blob: Aroma of lemon, grapefruit, orange and mango. Taste of spruce, mango, grapefruit. A bit too bitter and not as soft as other Hill Farmstead, and more lackluster.

Very juicy aroma, passionfruit, lemon, mango, orange, with a bit of bubblegum. Taste has a bit more acidity than others NE IPAs, clear yeast bubblegum flavour, lemony and passionfruity, a bit different. Very nice.

Big aroma of currants, mango, flowery, orange marmalade, typical Mosaic. Taste more so toward the balanced IPAs, a bit malt character with a big mango, passionfruit, guava and currants. A bit thin. Quite close to Trilliums Artaic, but doesnt pop as much.

Aroma of booze, chocolate, coconut, soy, caramel, oak, vanilla. Not near as much bourbon as the other Black Tuesday variants, and definitely the worst in aroma department. Taste is a bit sweeter, tannin, oak, vanilla, chocolate, heavy in your face brown sugar and kind-of hazelnutty, if you really want it to. A bit more cloying and less interesting than the other variants.
Aroma of light coffee, green pepper, vanilla, soy. Taste of pretty mellowed out fruity coffee, green pepper, vanilla, quite plain.
beer_name: Hill Farmstead Twilight of the Idols

review_blob: Glowing light orange with a big white head. Aroma of citrus, pine, apricot and mango. Taste quite juicy of tropical fruits with a restrained bitterness, nice mouthfeel. Had this blind next to PseudoSue & Zeelander, at this landed at the bottom.

Hazy glowing yellow with an eggshell head. Big whaf of bubblegum, overripe apricot, mango, peach, citrus, pine and spruce, Nicely balanced resin with mango, very much like the Tree Houses Green in hope profile with that big bubblegum, filled with juicy fruits and overripe apricot. Big creamy mouthfeel. The best HF hoppy beer, and maybe the best hoppy beer overall.
Big aroma of apricot, honey dew, passionfruit and mango. Taste very hoppy and quite green, very resiny, this is incredibly hoppy and filled with floral goodness.
Intense grapefruit aroma, with mandarin and lemon notes. A bit earthy as it warms up, really intense pink grapefruit. Very easy going and drinkable, with a big smack of flavor.

Juicy aroma of peach, nectarine, mango, passionfruit, spruce, a bit grassy on the end. Taste of straight up hops, simcoe/citra dominant with a grapefruit, mango and overripe apricot. This is really good, lacking the mouthfeel and the general lack of bitterness that the east coast has.

Big waft of vanilla, caramel, chocolate, coffee, butterscotch, oak and bourbon intense and rich. Taste of chocolate. A lot of it. And caramel, its noticeable that its fake, but still good, quite sweet with a bit of sour tang on the end, something negative to me, I guess all the black malts made this a bit too sour. Big mouthfeel, has a huge residual sweetness as well.
beer_name: Omnipollo Noa Pecan Mud Cake - Bourbon

review_blob: Aroma of white wine, cloudberry jam, big funk, oak, light vanilla, caramel, lemon, grapefruit pith. Taste a bit more mellowed out, tart cloudberries with a lightly bitter oaky caramel, quite woody and citrusy, but still feels heavy. I think this one needs some age.
Lemony with light yoghurt and earthy hops. Taste of lemon, peaches, apricot, with a metallic tang on the end. Pretty nice and very drinkable.

Aroma of bourbon, light booze, licorice, cherry/red berries, slight smoke. Taste of coffee, oak, bourbon with a vinous note that balances it quite well, a vanilla touch that makes it a whole lot better than the normal Stormaktsporter, but a bit too vinous and too low pH, which I think masks the chocolate and gives it a bit too harsh roast.

2007 on draft. Aroma of coffee, chocolate, light smoke, butterscotch, caramel, licorice. Taste heavily roasted, semi-sweet, raisins, figs, coffee, slightly vinous with slight cardboard oxidation. Quite thick and surprisingly good mouthfeel. Without the hype I would just classify this is a solid imperial stout, maybe its way past its time.

Aroma of burned sugar, booze, vodka, light bourbon caramel, vanilla, stale coffee. Taste of booze, light coffee, caramel. Lots of sugar in this, incredibly boozy and the coffee note is one of the worst Ive had. Probably the worst mouthfeel Ive ever had in a 11.8% beer, super thin and overcarbonated. This was really quite bad.
Roasted malt forward, easy vanilla, cinnamon, typical rye whiskey kind of spice which you can get from rum, burned sugar. Medium body with a very integrated barrel aging.
beer_name: FiftyFifty Imperial Eclipse Stout - 18 Year Rum Barrel

review_blob: Aroma of green apple skin, plum, horse, very vinegary. Taste is vinegary, very sour, apple skin, lemon, a bit of De Troch staple that I find in the OWA lambics as well, a perfumy spiciness. The least pleasant oude lambik ive tried.

Aroma of white grapes, buttery chardonnay oak, apricots, peaches, vanilla, very well integrated and feels with one. Very refreshing lemony fragrance. Taste of oak, apricot, white wine, peppery saison, quite tart, with a big lactic presence. A bit too carbonated.

Big fudgy bourbon, vanilla, toffee, maple, caramel, light raisins, dark fruits, figs, with an underlying coffee dominant stout. Very evened out toffee-like bourbon character that stays for long, dark fruit forward with a bit of raisins and figs, coffee, not that sweet, but really hits you hard.

Aroma of grapefruit, passionfruit, guava, melon, a bit of grass, straight up hoppy. Taste is incredibly hoppy, and doesnt leave the aroma behind in any sense, a bit herb like with big floral apricot reminiscent notes, best Pale Ale, surely.
beer_name: Trillium Fort Point Pale Ale - Double Dry Hopped

review_blob: Huge aroma of nectarines, melon, slight bilberry/blueberry, currants, citrus, basil with straight up apricot/nectarine juice. Incredibly juicy, showcases Mosaic excellently and is probably the best DIPA Ive had.
Big tree house yeast aroma - citrus, overripe mangoes, guava, slight banana estery, bubblegum, with passionfruit and grass to it, very nice and refreshing, but doesnt pop like other ones.

Juicy aroma with big a bit more yeasty esters and passionfruit forward, very much so a like Julius but a bit more melon and passionfruit, also a bit more grass. Feels like the yeast comes through more. A bit stronger fragnance and a bit more aggressive than Julius, I prefer this.

Aroma of chocolate, coffee, ligth vanilla, licorice, coconut, red over ripe apples, apple skin, light booze, with a woody component, very complex. Taste of chocolate fudge with a nice apple finish, very nicely integrated barrel character with a big dark chocolate forward beer, a bit chocolate fudge and caramel as well.
Aroma of farts, barnyard, a bit woody, mango, passionfruit with an earthy kick to it. Taste is lots of barnyard funk, very earthy, with a citric acid like fruitiness. This was quite nice.
Resin, grapefruit, apricot, light orange. Taste semi-sweet with a caramel backbone, a bit earthy with grapefruit, not as fruity as the other TH offerings.
Sweet citrus, light banana, yeast esters, grass, alcoholic. Taste is alcoholic, with a bit oxidized hops feel to it, not very refreshing, more so heavy and cloying with alcohol and overly estery.

Biscuity aroma, general wheat touch to it. Taste is cereal, quite grainy, a bit cracker-biscuit touch to it with a floral component. Great mouthfeel, like a real unfiltered pilsner, milky. I like this one, but its a lot better on draft than bottles.

Big aroma of tart raspberries, redcurrants, yoghurt. Taste very yoghurty with a nice raspberry kick, ever so slight sweetness on the end, and a bit mort tart then the mango version. Great creamy thick mouthfeel.
Peach and apricot with a big floral punch, light vanilla. Taste very smooth and mellowed out, light hoppy, soft floral with a nice milky feel to it. Very drinkable.
Cherry, light nail polish, a bit smoke and ash aroma. Semi sweet with a not very prominent stout base, mostly cherries, pretty weird.
Aroma of red currants, raspberry, dried cranberry, red apples. Taste is very very mineraly, light barnyard with an autumny ripe apple flavour, earthy and a bit complex, but not that flavorful.

Big flowery aroma, a bit soap, and nice orange and mango notes. Taste is more grassy, a bit pine and floral, but with big melon and mango, a bit too light body, but its very easy drinking and sessionable.

Hazy orange looking beer. Floral aroma with passionfruit and apricot notes. Taste of heavy citrus hops with pineapple and some mango, a bit grassy and spruce on the end, semi-dry with a creamy medium body. Great Pale Ale.

Aroma of apple, pear, grain, oak, dust, slight barnyard, light grain. Taste of apple juice, with an oaky vanilla touch to it, a big earthy and a bit hop bitterness still left, quite darker and mustier flavors quite complex, and suits better blended with a more refreshing citrusy lambic, big hop aftertaste with a flowery note. A bit oily which notes that this lambic probably isnt very old - around 1.5 years id guess on average, also it still has clear hop bitterness and light head.

Aroma of milk chocolate, coffee, green paprika, chili, a bit of aniseseed/licorice, nutmeg, general christmas spice. Taste is very milk chocolately, with some licorice and christmas spice, a bit allspice like, chili isnt that punchy, and the beer is way too thin.
beer_name: Chris Banker / Insurgente / Stone Xocoveza Mocha Stout

review_blob: Aroma of pine, melon, faint tropical fruit, resin, a bit woody and leathery taste, way too much dark crystal. Taste harsh and a bit astringent, bitter and not very soft, with notes of tropical fruit, pine needles and melon. This wasnt very good, and way too crystal malty.
beer_name: Founders Backstage Series #13: reDANKulous Imperial Red IPA

review_blob: Grapefruit, resin, and pine with a caramel hint. A bit earthy aroma as it warms up with light pear and apple notes. Taste is grapefruit straight a head, a bit head on bitterness with a toffee caramel nutty note. Nice beer

Aroma of passionfruit, pine, papaya, overripe apricots and orange. Very low bitterness with an overall fruity taste and a pine finish, quite low bitterness with great czech pils like mouthfeel, creamy milk like, great czech pale ale.

Aroma of grapefruit, pine with some nice orange to it, straight to the point classic west coast ipa. Taste as well, quite low bitterness and well balanced, not extremely hoppy, but the best hungarian beer I had.

Fresh aroma of citrus, floral, and earthy barnyard. A bit woody and oak goes through, and its very complex with a nutty layer of flavour aswell. Taste has big brett flavors, passionfruit, overripe apricot with some hay feel to it, a bit nuttiness, and more barrel character than the other unfruited offerings of cantillon.
